Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IRecord

  • IRecords are the primary data type of MessageAPI, holding collections (lists) of IFields and IConditions. IRecords are typically used in the context of an IRequest and then manipulated by the user through the API. When used in this way, each IRecord gets its own copy of every field and condition defined in the session manifest. Record Fields and Conditions can then be given values in the context of the Record. Lists of IRecords are the datatype passed into and out of all Containers - and they are passed out of every endpoint as part of a Packet (along with a list of Rejections).

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

        Returns a deep copy of the current state of the record

        Returns the Field object with the given name/id as held by the record.

        Returns the name of the fields contained by the record.

        Sets the validity of the record to the passed true/false status.

        Returns a deep copy of the current state of the record

        Returns the Field object with the given name/id as held by the record.

      • public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFieldIds()

        Returns the name of the fields contained by the record. This is a convenience method.

        Returns:
        List

      • public java.util.List<IField> getFields()

        Returns the fields that are contained by the record

      • public java.lang.Boolean hasCondition(java.lang.String conditionId)

        returns a true/false indicating whether the given field (by id/name) exists in the record. While all records have their fields defined outside of code, this method may be useful for code-level inspection and/or automation.

      • public java.lang.Boolean hasField(java.lang.String fieldId)

        returns a true/false indicating whether the given field (by id/name) exists in the record. While all records have their fields defined outside of code, this method may be useful for code-level inspection and/or automation.

      • public java.lang.Boolean isValid()

        Returns true/false whether the record is valid. The exact criteria for validity is abstract, but could typically be used if all conditions are validated against all fields.

      • public void setCondition(java.lang.Object condition, java.lang.Object value)

        Sets the given condition to hold the given value. The condition is specified here as an object so that different ways of condition reference may be used (e.g., by name/id or direct instance).

      • public void setConditions(java.util.List<ICondition> conditions)

        Sets the entire condition set for the record to the passed list of conditions.

      • public void setField(java.lang.Object field, java.lang.Object value)

        Sets the field value in the record for the specified field. The field is made an object so that multiple ways of field reference are possible (i.e., field by name or field instance itself).

      • public void setFields(java.util.List<IField> fields)

        Sets the entire fieldset for the record to the passed list of fields.

      • public void setValid(java.lang.Boolean status)

        Sets the validity of the record to the passed true/false status.
